info.text:
Test Bank

Elective I: Economic Globalization

Luis Francisco Gomez Lopez

Business Administration

Distance Learning Faculty

category.text: $course$/top/Electiva I: Globalización Económica AE A [B-1]/International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild

info.text: Questions based on the book Globalization from  International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild

category.text: $course$/top/Electiva I: Globalización Económica AE A [B-1]/International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild /Chapter 1 Globalization

name.text: Elements of Technological Innovation related to Globalization

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild the elements that played a role in fostering globalization related to technology were

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 1 page 39 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: The developments regarding the information and communications technologies (ICT) and the advancements in transportation technologies like global positioning systems
The reduction of costs in the transportation sector and the market penetration of cellphones in conjunction with internet that allowed people to communicate around the world
The sustained increase in demand for computers worldwide and the access to low-cost software that allowed the rapid expansion and development of mobile applications

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild the first age of globalization corresponds to

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 1 pages 33-34 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: The end of the 19th century and the beginnings of the 20th century where labor was highly mobile, trade and capital flowed more freely and where conventional modes of transportation evolved
The end of the Second World War where global trade was able to recover and trade barriers decreased progressively with the entry into force of the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade (GATT)
The fall of the Berlin Wall, the dissolution of the Soviet Union that integrates the eastern and western economies and the development of the information and communications technologies (ICT)

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild a global born company refers to

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 1 page 32 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: An enterprise that adopts a global perspective and engages in international business from or near its inception where tends to be innovative and knowledge based
A company generally made up by entrepreneurs and characterized as a small business who obtains financial resources from joint global ventures arrangements
An infant company which in its early stages of consolidation experiences relative difficulty or is incapable of competing with established competitors around the globe

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild globalization is define as

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 1 page 33 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: A trend toward greater technological, cultural, political and economical interdependence among economies and national institutions characterized by denationalization
A process of interaction and integration among individuals, enterprises, governments and regions around the globe which is consider as a form of capitalist expansion
A natural consequence of the opening up of the global economy and the result of increasing cultural global exchange, political international integration and trade between nations

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild the globalization of markets refers to

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 1 page 34 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: The convergence of buyer preferences around the globe which benefits companies through standardizing market activities, creating opportunities abroad and decreasing sales variability for international products

The process of adjusting the marketing strategies of a company to adapt to the conditions of other countries that entails the full process of planning, creating, positioning, and promoting products in the global economy

The strategy where a single product is sold according to a single standard marketing program to reduce costs and adapt it later for local needs in the context of a global economy with the objective of facilitating the operations of the enterprise

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild the globalization of production refers to

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 1 page 35 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: The allocation of production activities to locations abroad where companies can reduce costs and maximize the quality of the products they offer
Designing and managing the process of production and redesigning business operations of products in the context of international operations and the global economy
The specialization and diversification of manufacturing decisions and the adoption of production management strategies using a global perspective to trade goods

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) refers to

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 1 page 38 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: The value of all goods and services produced by a domestic economy in a specific period
The nation’s income generated from exports, imports and the international operations of its companies
The internal final production like commodities offered by a specific territory to the rest of the world

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild the conclusion about the income inequality debate is that

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 1 page 44 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: Globalization increases the incomes of poor people within nations, fosters economic growth for economies that integrate into the global economy, and has decreased global inequality
Globalization doesn’t boost the incomes of poor people within nations, but fosters economic growth for economies that integrate into the global economy, and doesn’t affect global inequality
Globalization boosts income of poor people within nations, however doesn’t foster economic growth for economies that integrates to the global economy and increase global inequality

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild the term international business refers to

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 1 page 30 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: Any commercial transaction of goods and services that crosses the borders of two or more countries in the global economy
The study of the internationalization process of multinational global enterprises and the economic and financial globalization
All the activities related to international business markets and the identification of relevant business global opportunities

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild the conclusion about the job and wages debate is that

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 1 page 44 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: Globalization eliminates jobs but creates also jobs in other sector of the economy and generates greater benefits at the national level
Globalization eliminates jobs in develop countries, lower wages in develop countries and exploit workers in developing countries
Globalization increases wealth ad efficiency in all nations and generates labor market flexibility in developed nations

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild the keys to global success are related to

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 1 page 32 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: Monitor global markets, communicate effectively, know the costumer, market effectively and have global awareness
Build a global vision, stay update in innovation , identify relevant opportunities in the global economy and be flexible
Have and open mind, tolerate the cultural differences, understand the global perspective of businesses and by efficient

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild the KOF index refers to

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 1 page 42 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: A measure created by the KOF Swiss Economic Institute to explore the economic, social and political dimensions of globalization
An indicator to measure the barriers and obstacles of international trade around the world created by the Maastricht University
An economic variable created by the Foreign Policy magazine to describe the behavior of globalization in relation to trade and technology

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild the major flaw in the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade (GATT) was that

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 1 page 35 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: It was an agreement that lacked the power to enforce world trade rules between countries around the globe
It was not necessary taking into account the creation and consolidation of the World Trade Organization (WTO)
It was outdated because it had not been revised since 1947, where it did not reflect the changes of international trade

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild a multinational corporation is

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 1 page 30 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: A business that has direct investments abroad in multiples countries and that is a key player in international business because of its revenues and jobs it creates
A corporate organization that owns or controls production of goods or services in at least two different continents and their worldwide activities are centrally controlled
An enterprise operating in one country but managed from several countries that derives the majority of its revenue from operations and production outside of its home country

name.text: World Bank and International Monetary Fund

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild the World Bank and the International Monetary Fund are

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 1 page 37 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: Agencies created to provide financial aid to developing countries and enforce the rules of the international monetary system
Agencies created to enforce the rules of trade and and the implementation of modern customs systems and procedures around the globe
Agencies created to achieve international cooperation and be a center for harmonizing the actions related to the international financial system

category.text: $course$/top/Electiva I: Globalización Económica AE A [B-1]/International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild /Chapter 5 International Trade Theory

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild the concepts of absolute and comparative advantage can be used to conclude that

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 5 pages 163-166 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: It is not possible that a country doesn’t have a comparative advantage in some good but it is possible that the country doesn’t have an absolute advantage
If a country doesn’t have and absolute advantage in the production of any good then doesn’t exist a benefit to trade with this country
A country can simultaneously have an absolute and comparative advantage in all goods relative to all countries in a global economy

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild the benefits of international trade are

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 5 page 156 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: An increase in the choice of goods and services and an engine for job creation in the export sector
Improving the efficiency of markets by making markets more contestable and generating more consumption
Generating welfare gains by increasing innovation and technology transfers from other countries

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild the relation between the factors proportions theory and the theory of comparative advantage is that

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 5 page 167 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: The factors proportions theory differs from the theory of comparative advantage because it is based on the abundance of factors of production
The factors proportions theory is an extension of the theory of comparative advantage which includes the capital as an input in addition to labor
The factors proportions theory negates the theory of comparative advantage and supports the concept of absolute advantage in relation to trade

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild the value of trade can be measure as

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 5 page 156 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: The sum of exports and imports divided by the Gross Domestic Product and multiply by 100 where it can be equal to, less than o greater that 100%
The difference between exports and imports as a share of Gross Domestic Product and multiply by 100 where its maximum value is 100%
The multiplication between exports and imports as a share of Gross Domestic Product and multiply by 100 where its minimum value is 100%

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild the Leontief paradox refers to

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 5 page 167 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: A study by Wassily Leontief showing that United States had an abundance of capital but exports labor-intensive products contradicting the factor proportions theory
A study by Wassily Leontief demonstrating that the theory of comparative advantage didn’t apply to the United States economy in relation to other countries of the global economy
A study by Wassily Leontief showing that although United States had an absolute advantage in the production of certain goods it didn’t exports those goods

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild the three pillars of mercantilism are

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 5 page 161 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: Wealth in a nation is related to a positive trade surplus, government protects domestic industries and colonialism is used to obtain raw materials
Wealth in a nation is related to a negative trade deficit, government subsidies imports and colonialism is used to control strategic resources
Wealth in a nation is related to a neutral balance of trade, government protects the national industries and colonialism must foster imports

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild the main objective of the national competitive advantage theory is to

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 5 page 171 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: Explain why certain countries are more competitive in the production of certain goods and services
Explain trading patterns of imports and exports that are presented within and between regions
Explain the relation between market structures and the level of innovation in the global economy

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild the first-mover advantage in the context of new theory establishes that

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 5 page 170 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: A company that enters a market first, in the context of international trade, can create barriers to entry for other companies
A company that is a pioneer in its industry is more likely to be more innovative and efficient in the international markets
A company that manages to position itself in international markets is necessarily a leader in the local market and becomes a monopoly

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild the volume of international trade and the world output behaves such that

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 5 page 156 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: The volume of trade grows faster than world output and these variables are positively related
The volume of trade grows slower than world output and these variables are negatively related
The volume of trade grows at the same rate as world output and these variables are not related

category.text: $course$/top/Electiva I: Globalización Económica AE A [B-1]/International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild /Chapter 9 International Financial Markets

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild a capital market es define as

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 9 page 249 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: A system that allocates financial resources in the form of dept and equity according to their most efficient uses
A financial market in which long-term debt or equity are bought and sold in an international environment
A market for long-term securities, including the stock and bond market, where buyers and sellers engage in international trade

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild counter-trade is

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 9 page 264 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: The practice of exchanging goods or services which are paid for, in whole or part, with other goods or services as opposed with currency
The practice of restricting the trade of goods and services to control the exchange rates in a domestic economy and applied by central banks
The practice of using strategic trade policy in order to affect the outcome of interactions between the participants of the foreign exchange market

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild an Eurobond is

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 9 page 252 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: A bond issued outside a domestic economy in a currency not native to the economy where it is issued
A international financial instrument issued in euros by governments belonging to the European Union
A collateral that is exchanged in the eurozone whose main purpose is to protect the interests of the lender

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild the financial markets are essential to the international business because

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 9 page 248 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: They allocate money from organizations and economies with excess funds to those with shortages and allow companies to exchange one currency for another
They play a major role in the economic growth of a country acting as an intermediary between savers and investors to allocate goods and services in an efficient way
They serve as a mechanism to deploy capital or money to its most efficient use enabling savers from across the world to invest their money in distant emerging economies

name.text: Forces expanding the international capital market

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild the forces that expanded the international market were

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 9 page 250 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: The evolution of information technology like electronic trading, deregulation of national capital markets and the development of innovative financial instruments
The accelerated financial deepening in the developing countries, innovation in telecommunications and the introduction of international financial agreements around the world
The development of financial instruments, as well as new financial technologies, markets and institutions in the world financial centers around the globe

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild the foreign exchange market refers to

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 9 page 254 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: A market in which different currencies are bought and also sold where there exchange rates are determined
A source of funding to raise the appropriate type of capital that best fits the needs of a multinational company
A means by which individuals access the international market to buy products using other foreign currencies

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild a forward exchange contract is define as

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 9 page 260 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: A kind of derivative that requires the exchange of and agreed-on amount of a currency on a agreed-on date at a specified exchange rate
A kind of swap where an agreement is established to exchange a currency between 2 parties, employed to obtain loans at favorable interest rates
A contract between 2 or more entities, which are legally linked, to exchange different currencies for a specific asset where this asset is usually gold

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild a forward exchange rate is define as

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 9 page 259 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: The exchange rate at which two parties agree to exchange currencies on a specified future date
The exchange rate that is stable and linked to another currency or asset to derive its value
The exchange rate where its fluctuation is maintained by the central bank within a certain range

name.text: Functions of the foreign exchange market

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild some of the functions of the foreign exchange market are

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 9 page 254 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: To convert one currency into another and insure against potential losses due to variability of exchange rates
To allocate in an efficient way the products around the globe and determine its prices in different currencies
To allow borrowers and lenders access different currencies and establish the fair level of exchange rates

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild the Interbank foreign exchange market is

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 9 page 262 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: A market where world’s largest banks exchange currencies at a spot and forward rates around the globe
A market where central banks buy currencies under the supervision of the International Monetary Fund
A market where multinationals obtain significant quantities of currencies to trade in domestic economies

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild the components of the international capital market are

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 9 page 252 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: The market of domestic currencies that are banked outside the countries of origin, the market of stocks bought and sold outside the domestic territory issuer and the market of bonds sold by issuing organizations out side their own countries

The forex market where participants exchange and speculate on currencies, the international derivatives market where futures and contracts are trade and the international monetary system regulated by the International Monetary Fund

The international trade of products controlled by the World Customs Organization, the real estate international market in which land and buildings are trade around the world and the international currency market where currencies are sell

name.text: Purposes of the international capital market

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild the purposes of the international capital market are

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 9 page 249 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: To expand the money supply, reduce the cost for borrowers and mitigate the risk for lenders by spreading their investments on a diversify number of debt and equity instruments
To promote economic efficiency in the international markets by allowing individuals to invest in physical capital goods, which will be used to help increase their income in the long term
To help countries to effectively reduce the gap between household savings and productive investment opportunities in the real economy by allocating debt and equity in an efficient way

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild if the exchange rate between Colombian peso (COP) and USA Dollar (USD) is expressed as COP / USD then

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 9 page 256 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: The Colombian peso (COP) is the quoted currency and the USA Dollar (USD) is the base currency
The Colombian peso (COP) is the indirect rate quote and the USA Dollar (USD) is the direct rate quote
The Colombian peso (COP) is the currency denominator and the USA Dollar (USD) is the currency numerator

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild a spot rate is define as

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 9 page 259 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: The exchange rate requiring delivery of the traded currency within two working days
The exchange rate defined in an agreement to purchase or sell a currency at a future date
The exchange rate determined by the market forces without any government intervention

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild a vehicle currency is define as

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 9 page 261 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: A currency used as an intermediary to convert funds between two other currencies
A currency that is accepted for trade and is used as a global medium of exchange
A currency that is held in significant quantities by central banks or other authorities

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild an offshore financial center is a

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 9 page 251 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: A territory whose financial sector is characterized by few regulations and low taxation which can by categorized as operational or booking centers
A jurisdiction that provides financial services to nonresidents in a domestic economy with low regulation but with a high level taxation for financial instruments
A country where multinational corporations find attractive for establishing subsidiaries because there is a deep and adequate development of the financial local market

category.text: $course$/top/Electiva I: Globalización Económica AE A [B-1]/International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild /Chapter 10 International Monetary System

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild if the exchange rate between Colombian peso (COP) and USA Dollar (USD) is expressed as COP / USD then

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 10 page 272 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: If the exchange rate increases then the Colombian peso (COP) devalues with respect to the USA Dollar (USD)
If the exchange rate increases then the Colombian peso (COP) revaluates with respect to the USA Dollar (USD)
If the exchange rate decreases then the Colombian peso (COP) devalues with respect to the USA Dollar (USD)

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild the fundamental analysis in the context of forecasting exchange rates refers to

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 10 page 274 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: A technique that uses statistical models based on fundamental economic indicators to forecast
A technique that usually uses charts of past trends in currency prices an other factors to forecast
A technique that uses the seasonal and cyclical movements of financial instruments to forecast

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild is the international monetary system is

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 10 page 280 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: A collection of agreements and institutions that govern exchange rates around the globe
A systems in which nations link the value of their paper currencies to specific values of gold
A mechanism in which the exchange rate for converting one currency into another is fixed

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild a managed float system is

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 10 page 284 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: A exchange rate system in which currencies float against one another, which governments intervening to stabilize their currencies at a particular target
A exchange rate system in which currencies float freely against one another, without governments intervening in the currency markets
A exchange rate system based on an explicit commitment to exchange domestic currency for a specified foreign currency at a fixed exchange rate

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild the market efficient view in the context of exchange rates refers to

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 10 page 273 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: A theory that states that prices of financial instruments reflect all publicly available information at any given time which means that forward exchange rates are accurate forecasts of future exchange rates
A theory that states that prices of financial instruments are influenced by past events at any given time which means that lag spot exchange rates are accurate forecasts of future exchange rates
A theory that states that prices of financial instruments are not influenced by future or past events at any given time which means that real exchange rates are essentially random walks

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild the Fisher effect refers to

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 10 page 278 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: A principle that relates inflation to interest rates where it is pointed out that nominal interest rate is the sum of the real interest rate and the expected rate of inflation over a specific period
A law where it is pointed out that the inflation rate that is equal to the price of the basket of goods at one location divided by the price of the basket of goods at a different location
A postulate where it establishes that a country should specialize in producing and exporting only those goods and services which it can produce more efficiently at a lower opportunity cost

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild the international Fisher effect refers to

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 10 page 279 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: A principle which establishes that a difference in nominal interests rates supported by two countries’ currencies will cause an equal but opposite change in their spot exchange rates
A law where it is pointed out that the inflation rate of a domestic economy tends to converge to the level of exchange rate of the mayor international trade partner of this economy
A postulate that it establishes that a country should maintain a fixed exchange rate system through the gold standard to control a persistent increasing in prices of a domestic economy

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild the law of one price refers to

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 10 page 275 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: A principle that establishes that an identical product must have an identical price in all countries when the price is expressed in a common currency
A theory that postulates that exchange rates around the world tend to converge to a specific value based on the fundamentals of the global economy
An empirical regularity identified in relation to the prices of goods and services trade around the world where they tend to be equal to the real exchange rates

category.text: $course$/top/Electiva I: Globalización Económica AE A [B-1]/International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild /Chapter 13 Selecting and Managing Entry Modes

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild the possible degrees of export involvement for a company include

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 13 page 344 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: Direct exporting through a sales representative or a distributor and indirect exporting through agents, export management companies or export trading companies
Countertrade by selling products that are paid with other products and switch trading by selling to another company its obligation to make a purchase in a given country
Buyback by exporting industrial equipment in return for products produced by that equipment and offset by making a hard-currency purchase of a unspecified product from a country in the future

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild to develop a export strategy a company should

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 13 page 343 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: Identify a potential market, determine if it is capable to satisfy the needs of the market, initiate meetings with potential local distributors and commit human, financial and physical resources
Locate a stable country, identify restrictions on international trade like tariffs, import quotas an licenses and understand the rivals in the foreign market using competitive intelligence tools

Explore possible trade agreements in force, make a market research to collect information in order to use it in the decision-making process and allocate resources to establish contacts in the foreign market

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild an entry mode is define as

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 13 page 342 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: An institutional arrangement by which a company gets its products, technologies, human skills or other resources into a market
A set of strategies adopted by multinationals for organizing and conducting international business transactions such as contractual transfers
The best way to enter a new market for a born global company such as contractual transfers, joint ventures and wholly owned operations

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild some methods of export/import financing are

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 13 page 347 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: An advanced payment where an importer pays an exporter for merchandise before it is shipped and an open account where an exporter ships merchandise and later bills the importer for its value
A letter of credit where a bank act as an intermediary by accepting all the financial risk and documentary collection where the importer’s bank issues a document to pay the exporter
A bill of lading where the importer pay the exporter a specified sum of money at a specified time and a bill of exchange where a contract between the exporter and the shipper is established

name.text: Key strategic factors in selecting an entry mode

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild some key strategic factors in selecting an entry mode are

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 13 page 359 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: Political instability can cause companies to favor entry modes that limit investments and companies tend to first go abroad by exporting and to later select entry modes that require deeper involvement
Managers that are less confident in their abilities in unfamiliar cultures must embrace investment entry modes and avoid at all cost exporting and contractual modes that implies a greater risk
Producing at home is desirable when production costs in a foreign market are high compared to a domestic economy and when shipping costs are low where an investment entry mode is advisable

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild the contractual entry mode known as licensing refers to

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 13 page 351 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: A practice by which one company owning intangible property grants another company the right to use that property for a specified period of time
A practice by which companies use licensing agreements to exchange intangible property with one another usually for a complete business year
A practice by which one company supplies another company with intangible property and other assistance over an extended period of time

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild the contractual entry mode known as management contract refers to

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 13 page 354 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: A practice by which one company supplies another company with managerial expertise for a specific period of time
A practice by which one company designs, constructs and tests a production facility for a client in another company
A practice where a company is created and jointly owned by two or more independent entities to achieve a common objective

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild companies exports to

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 13 page 342 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: Expand total sales, diversify sales and gain international business experience
Sell the excess production and fix higher prices to consumers in other countries
Increase the competitiveness in all markets and smooth the business cycles

category.text: $course$/top/Electiva I: Globalización Económica AE A [B-1]/International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild /Chapter 15 Managing International Operations

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild the process of capacity planning refers to

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 15 page 388 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: Assessing a company’s ability to produce enough output to satisfy market demand
Selecting the location for production facilities to benefit from location economies
Acquiring the inputs to design new products necessary for a differentiation strategy

name.text: Potential ways to finance business operations

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild some possible ways to finance business operations of a company are

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 15 page 397 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: Revenue from ongoing operations of the company to help its expansion and financing obtained from investors who believe that the company will experience rapid growth and where they expect to receive equity in return

Back-to-back loans where and external international investor deposits money in a host-country bank which then lends this money to the company and issuing equity to access pools of investors with external funds

External funding through a swapping of debt or equity, charging royalties, licensing fees and issuing depository receipts certificates that are trade in the domestic financial market and that represent a number of shares

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild the process planning refers to

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 15 page 390 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: Deciding the process that a company will use to create its own production
Deciding the spatial arrangement of production within production facilities
Deciding whether production process will by standardized or adapted for markets

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild the Total Quality Management refers to

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 15 page 395 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: A company wide commitment to meet or exceed customer expectations through continuous quality improvement efforts and processes
An international certification that companies get when they meet the highest possible quality standards in their respective industries
A production technique in which inventory is kept to a minimum and inputs to the production process arrive when they are needed

questiontext.text: According to the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020) by Wild, John J, and Kenneth L Wild vertical integration refers to

generalfeedback.text: Checkout Chapter 15 page 392 in the book International Business: The Challenges of Globalization (2020)

answer.text: The process by which a company extends its control over additional stages of production, either inputs or outputs
The process by which a company decides whether to make a specific component or to buy it from another company
The process by which a company buys from another company a product that is part of a company’s value-added activities
